intro: Roussinia indica, commonly known as the Indian roussinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and related plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Roussinia indica is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
